intro: Silene pusilla subsp. malyi, commonly known as the Malyi mouse-ear, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and tiny, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Silene pusilla subsp. malyi is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy, often pink or red flowers.
